summary: This bill, the 'Independent and Objective Oversight of Ukrainian Assistance Act,' establishes an Office of the Special Inspector General to independently audit and investigate the use of U.S. funds allocated for military, economic, and humanitarian aid to Ukraine. The Inspector General will monitor spending, review contracts, and report on the effectiveness of aid programs. The office will promote transparency by issuing quarterly reports and making information available to the public, with potential waivers for national security reasons. The bill authorizes appropriations and sets a termination date based on unspent funds.
